newsitem.title: UNITED ARAB EMIRATES: SOCCER-HELICOPTER FLIGHTS OVER STADIUM BANNED.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-HELICOPTER FLIGHTS OVER STADIUM BANNED.

text.p: The Asian Football Confederation (AFC) said on Monday it was banning helicopter flights over Abu Dhabi stadium during Asian Cup matches in response to a Kuwaiti complaint.
Kuwait had complained that helicopters hovering over the Zayed stadium had distracted its players during the team's 2-3 defeat to hosts the UAE.
Kuwait had squandered a first half two-goal lead to lose the match.

''I have directed the higher Organising Committee that there shall not be any further helicopter flights directly over the stadium during matches of the Asian Cup 96,'' AFC secretary-general Datu Peter Vellapaan said in a letter to the head of Kuwait's delegation.
The AFC also dismissed a Kuwaiti protest against a referee's decision not to send off a UAE player who it claimed had committed a professional foul.
